Wuyang

Wielder of healing technology from Wuxing University’s Water College, Wuyang is always ready to turn the tide of battle.

Support

Wuxing University, Chengdu

May 1 (Age: 19)

Abilities

Xuanwu StaffRestorative StreamRushing TorrentTidal BlastGuardian Wave

Xuanwu Staff

Fire a damaging water orb. Hold to control its trajectory and empower its explosion.

Restorative Stream

Place a passive healing stream on an ally. Hold on the target to manually heal at an improved rate, consuming resource.

Rushing Torrent

Ride water to move faster and jump higher.

Tidal Blast

Protect an ally or yourself with water that detonates after a short duration. The explosion knocks down enemies and massively heals the host target.

Guardian Wave

Send a water wave forward that increases the amount of healing received by allies and knocks back enemies.

Keys displayed are defaults for PC. They are configurable in game.

Stadium Powers

Stadium Powers are ability-changing upgrades obtainable in the Armory. Each hero has 12 unique Powers to choose from.

Undertow

For each Primary fire hit, gain 5% healing resource and reduce Rushing Torrent cooldown by 1s.

Wave Lance

Non-empowered Primary Fire shoots straight and gains 100% increased projectile speed.

Paindrops

After using Guardian Wave, Wuyang can shoot 2 additional water orbs for 8s. Each deals 40% damage.

Flow State

While Rushing Torrent is active, every 50 healing with Active Restorative Stream extends the duration of Rushing Torrent by 2s.

Tidekeeper

Every 1s during Active Restorative Stream reduces Guardian Wave cooldown by 1.5s.

Shore Up

Using Active Restorative Stream on ally heals Wuyang for 75% of healing.

Streamline

While Rushing Torrent is activated, place Passive Restorative Stream on all allies within line of sight.

Puddle Stomp

While Rushing Torrent is active, landing from a jump heals all allies within 6m for 65 for every 1s spent falling.

Splish Slash

While Rushing Torrent is active, airborne Quick Melee activates a 50% short Guardian Wave and a splash attack with 60 damage per every second dropped. (15s Cooldown)

Storm Surge

Guardian Wave creates a second wave that splashes to targets within 6m around Wuyang.

Tidal Save

Guardian Wave heals allies with Passive Restorative Stream for an extra 100% over 4s.

Ebb and Flow

Guardian Wave rewinds to its starting location with 50% damage.

Undertow

For each Primary fire hit, gain 5% healing resource and reduce Rushing Torrent cooldown by 1s.

Wave Lance

Non-empowered Primary Fire shoots straight and gains 100% increased projectile speed.

Paindrops

After using Guardian Wave, Wuyang can shoot 2 additional water orbs for 8s. Each deals 40% damage.

Flow State

While Rushing Torrent is active, every 50 healing with Active Restorative Stream extends the duration of Rushing Torrent by 2s.

Tidekeeper

Every 1s during Active Restorative Stream reduces Guardian Wave cooldown by 1.5s.

Shore Up

Using Active Restorative Stream on ally heals Wuyang for 75% of healing.

Streamline

Puddle Stomp

More on Stadium

Story

Wuyang Ye has always dreamed of carrying on his family's legacy at the Wuxing University Fire College. But when he’s accepted into the Water College instead, he faces an uphill battle to discover his personal strengths and prove them – to his family, and to himself.

EARLY LIFE

Wuyang grew up seeking to uphold his family’s legacy with the prestigious Wuxing University Fire College. Striving to meet their standards, he and his older sister, Anran, trained daily in various forms of kung fu, hoping to follow in the footsteps of their parents. But while Anran was easily accepted as a top student, Wuyang's best efforts were not enough to make the Fire College’s admittance cut off. Instead, he was accepted to the school’s Water College: a program that taught traditional Chinese healing methods and philosophies and how to apply them to the modern world. Unable to pursue the same field of study as his family, Wuyang was left questioning how to navigate the road ahead.

WUXING UNIVERSITY: WATER COLLEGE

During Wuyang’s first year in the Water College, he was surprised to find how much he enjoyed his studies. Learning about qi gong came naturally to him, and he found his classes mentally fulfilling, even if not as intense as the action-packed training of the Fire College. But in the back of his mind, it nagged at him that he was the black sheep of the family. He wanted to give his parents a reason to be proud of him despite his initial setbacks. Determined to find a way to marry his studies with his childhood training, he hatched a plan.

Wuyang asked his best friend from the Metal College, Ming, to adapt one of his prototype staves into a tool that would let him manipulate the trajectory of water. With Ming’s creation in hand, he began studying Fire College techniques in addition to his normal schoolwork, coming up with innovative fighting combinations from the teachings of both the Fire and Water schools.

NULL SECTOR IN CHENGDU

One night while Wuyang was studying, Null Sector suddenly launched an attack on Chengdu. With official forces on the way, the University's students were deployed to help evacuate citizens. After a heated argument with Anran, he reluctantly stayed behind to help injured civilians while she headed onto the battlefield with her classmates.

But it wasn’t long before the tide of battle turned against them. Anran's unit had been ambushed by a Null Sector—and she'd stayed behind to buy the others time to escape. Fearing for his sister’s life, Wuyang rushed into the city to her aid, finding her completely surrounded by warbots. Using his own Water-based combat techniques, Wuyang completely wiped out the Null Sector units, saving his sister. Together, Anran and Wuyang fought their way back out of the city.

Their heroic efforts were recognized by all, including the headmaster of the school—and more importantly, his parents. However, they were not the only ones who had taken notice of Wuyang’s feat. Some weeks later, he discovered a small medallion slipped under his dorm room door— one containing an invitation to join the newly reunited Overwatch. With renewed confidence and his sister’s encouragement, he prepared to join forces with them in his journey ahead.

Reign of Talon

Wuyang and Anran were making their journey to Watchpoint: Gibraltar for the first time when Talon launched their assault. The siblings dove into the fight, helping Overwatch deal with  the sudden attack—proof that they’re ready to help in the many battles ahead.
